item.title: SQL Console for Django Admin
item.description: From time to time when working on django project I tend to need to write out some sql queries to either check something out, update records or to write out the sql version of the ORM. On ocassions there is no direct acces to the database, so having a sql console within the django app might be a good idea. I decided to write a small django app that does this.

item.title: Quick Visualization of Used Car Prices
item.description: I was recently looking for a used car, specifically a Mercedes Benz. To get a general idea of the used car market prices, I needed to collect data about the prices. There are various websites, in South Africa, that have a huge selection of used and new cars such as autotrader Manually searching for “Mercedes Benz” yielded about 4500 results, nice. Even though I was searching for a specific class, I choose to rather search on the general “Mercedes Benz” rather than say “Mercedes Benz C180” as I thought this might also include cars which might not have the class name in them.

item.title: Archiving My Receipts
item.description: For the longest time I’ve been meaning to better manage my plastic bags of receipts, finally got around to build an application to archive my receipts and to keep track of my expenses. Its a very simple application and hopefully down the line I’ll be able do do some analysis on the data I generate. Check out the project here

item.title: CSS Frameworks Take You Far
item.description: I’m a big fan of css frameworks, since I mainly work on backend applications, have a framework to build out the UI for me is great. I’m okay with the phrase Every website looks like bootstrap, if bootstrap, or any other framework, can get the product out the door and into the hands of users. I came across a framwork called Bulma which has very simple stying and no javascript. I quickly realased that if you are not building complex or interactive UI’s this framework is great.

item.title: Concept - Django project as a debian package
item.description: Concept - Django project as a debian package For the past couple of months I’ve been pondering whether it would be possible to package a full django project as debian package (.deb). Now and then I tend to write small web applications that run on my machine and use the SQLite database. On one occasion somebody asked if they could run the application on their machine. These small web applications tend to just use Django, Django Rest Framework, JavaScript(eg: jquery) and a CSS framework that does not need to be customised or built and on some occasions a background task like celery.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a software developer with 8 years experience in the industry. I’m currently on the machine learning path and finding applicable use cases for it. I’m also playing around with electronics and integrating them with web development. I’ve dabbled in rust on and off but now I think it’s time to focus on it. This blog is mainly my notes about what I’ve done and learnt.

item.title: Projects
item.description: These are a couple of project dodads that I’ve worked on my spare time. Django SqlConsole Sqlconsole is a django app that allows for the execution of sql queries from the admin section of a django site. Django Qoqa Django-qoqa is a command-line application to create Django’s projects and to package them as Debian packages. Django Bulma Widget Bulma widget is a django package that intergrates the Bulma css framework with django forms.
